news_header: Over ten million people have fled their homes in Sudan due to ongoing conflict, with personal accounts from two individuals highlighting their struggles and the dire situation in the country.
news_text: The war in Sudan has forced over ten million people to flee their homes, with more than eight million becoming internally displaced. Two Sudanese individuals, Ozaz Hamid and Giballa Ahmed, share their harrowing experiences. Hamid, a university student, had plans for an internship in New York but was forced to escape Khartoum when fighting erupted between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the RSF. He left with his young daughter, facing numerous dangers along the way. Ahmed, who worked for the UN, also fled with his family from Darfur to Chad, seeking safety. Both families now reside in Nairobi, Kenya, where they face challenges but have found some stability compared to many others. The situation in Sudan remains dire, with widespread hunger and violence continuing to escalate.
